                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_uk.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Details of a harmful or undesirable effect, including allergy and intolerance, associated with known or suspected exposure to a drug or other medicinal substance.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Adverse reaction</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="comment">For GP2GP V2 use, it is currently anticipated that there will be 4 permissible ways to express a Causative agent: 
Drug Group (SNOMED-CT),
dm+d VMP/AMP (dm+d), 
Ingredient (SNOMED-CT),
 TradeFamily/TradeFamilyGroup (SNOMED-CT).
 It is MANDATORY that one and only one of these must always be selected. Optionally, in addition a SNOMED AllergyCode may be sent as a mapping, but can never be sent on its own. 
For legacy use other codes are permissible such as FDB Agent codes, EMIS Drug codes and READ codes but these should be carried as simple free text and the coded information carried in mappings/translation attributes. This kind of coding is not regarded as being safe to trigger decision support outwith the native GP system.
The exact subset definitions have not yet been agreed and may change prior to full implementation.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the agent or medicinal substance believed to be the cause of the adverse reaction or allergy.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Causative agent</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="comment">This item has a Translation Set between Read Codes (V2 or CTV3) and Snomed Codes to ensure forwards and backwards compatibility.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The certainty with which the reaction is deemed to be be due to allergy to the agent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Certainty</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">An optional pre-coordinated unqualified SNOMED-CT code for the nature of the reaction produced by the  drug allergy.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Reaction</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="comment">This item has a Translation Set = Read Code (V2 or CTV3) and Snomed Code to ensure forwards and backwards compatability.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The severity of the reaction.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Severity</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction was mild.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Mild</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction was moderate.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Moderate</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction was severe.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Severe</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction was life-threatening.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Life-threatening</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction is thought unlikely to have been caused by the agent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Unlikely</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction is thought likely to have been caused by the agent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Likely</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction to the agent has been confirmed by challenge testing or other concrete evidence.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Confirmed by challenge testing</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                    <items id="description">The agent is thought to be certain to have caused the reaction but this has not been confirmed by challenge testing.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Certain</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                    <items id="comment">From Welsh IHR / openHR model.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date that the reaction was clinically recorded/asserted. This will  often equate to the date of onset of the reaction but this may not be wholly clear from source data.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date recorded</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                    <items id="comment">From Welsh IHR model</items>
                                    <items id="description">Any additional comment or clarification about the adverse reaction.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                    <items id="description">Details of the provenance of the record e.g. source, name and role of author, care setting.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Record provenance</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="description">Details of a single reaction thought to be due to the causative agent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Reaction details</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                    <items id="description">The reaction was fatal.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Fatal</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of a treatment, medicine, vaccine or procedure which should not be administered or performed on this subject.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Contraindication</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the identified Contraindication with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identified contraindication to a treatment, medicine, vaccine or procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Contraindication</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="comment">This should be explicitly stated, so that this rationale can be explicit if this data is shared in a message or with another clinical system, although an optional link to evidence within the same record is also permitted.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Evidence or rationale for the contraindication.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Evidence/Rationale</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the contraindication was most recently deemed to apply, normally as a result of  clinical assertion or affirmation.</items>

                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Generic, positive statement/s that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000.1">
                                    <items id="description">Positive statement/s about adverse reactions that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion of an Adverse Reaction</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="comment">Use to capture any information that is needed to be positively recorded as being excluded within the record. The statement can support recording global statements or statements about a specified object. See specialisations for Medications, Adverse Reactions, Problem/Diagnosis and Procedures as common examples that have been explicitly modelled.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The statement about an exclusion in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002.1">
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "No known adverse reactions"; "No known adverse reaction to" (penicillin).</items>
                                    <items id="description">A statement about exclusion of known adverse reactions in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the specific object/s to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Specific Object</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003.1">
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the Substance/Agent with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the specific substance or agent to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Substance/Agent</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the exclusion was last clinically asserted, affirmed or confirmed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date Last Updated</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the Exclusion not captured in other fields.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Record of a vaccine administration procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation procedure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="description">The name or type of immunisation given, often the name of the target disease e.g. 'Hepatitis B'.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation name</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The sequence number in a series of immunisations e.g. 3rd DTP.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Series number</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="description">The reason why a vaccination was withheld.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Reason withheld</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="description">The immunisation has been administered.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation administered</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="description">Administration of the immunisation has been deferred.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation administration deferred</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                    <items id="description">The first call for immunisation has been issued.</items>
                                    <items id="text">First call issued</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="description">The immunisation course has been completed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation course completed</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="description">The course of immunisations has been refused.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation course refused</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="description">The immunisation course has been permanently discontinued.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Immunisation course discontinued</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="description">A link to an associated medication administration record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Medication administration record</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="description">An additional comment about the vaccination process.</items>

                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.problem_status.v1</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="description">Additional status and contextual qualifiers factors related to a problem/diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Problem context qualifiers</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                    <items id="description">Episodicity is used within a primary care context to distinguish between ongoing and new episodes of a problem or diagnosis, primarily for public health or quality assessment purposes.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Episodicity</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                    <items id="description">The degree to which the problem is active and relevant within the current clinical context.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Active status</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                    <items id="description">Records temporal/evidential progress towards identification of the problem or diagnosis, recognising that precise identification may take time to evolve as increasing amounts of evidence become available.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Evolution</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                    <items id="description">A numeric or textual representation of the priority assigned to the problem, relative to other problems in a list. This may be used to sort items according to perceived clinical priority or to filter problems felt to be of greater /lesser significance.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Priority</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                    <items id="description">A flag or text/ coded item recording whether this problem/diagnosis should be presented in a patient summary. Applications may implement this in a variety of ways.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Summarisation</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                    <items id="description">The diagnosis has been made at the outset of the diagnostic process with limited evidence available.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Initial assessment</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis has been identified with some confidence but further evidence has yet to be considered.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Interim/working assessment</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is made at the end of the diagnostic process taking into account all available significant evidence. It is not expected to change.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Final assessment</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                                    <items id="description">Description of the impact of the problem or diagnosis on the patient as a whole. Unlike 'severity' this can be used to compare the clinical impact of different problems.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Impact</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is currently active and clinically relevant.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Active</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is not completely resolved but is inactive or felt less relevant to the current clinical context.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Inactive</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is completely resolved and therefore not relevant to the current clinical context.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Resolved</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                                    <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Certainty</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0033">
                                                    <items id="description">The first ever occurence of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">First ever</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0034">
                                                    <items id="description">A new occurence of an existing problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">New</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                                    <items id="description">Part of an ongoing occurence of an existing problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Ongoing</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem has had no impact on the subject.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">None</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem has had very little overall impact on the subject's life or health.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Insignificant</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem has had considerable overall impact on the subject's life or health.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Significant</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem has threatened the subject's life.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Life-threatening</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                                                    <items id="description">A text comment on the active status e.g describing the circumstances or evidence for resolution of a problem.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Active status comment</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0044">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem was fatal to the subject.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Fatal</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0045">
                                                    <items id="description">The probem has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Possible</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0046">
                                                    <items id="description">The probem has been identified with only a moderate level of certainty.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0047">
                                                    <items id="description">The probem has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Probable</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0048">
                                                    <items id="description">The probem has been identified with a very-high level of certainty.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Definite</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0049">
                                                    <items id="description">The probem has been identified and confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0051">
                                                    <items id="description">Cateories of problem/ diagnosis/issue.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Category</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0052">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is a condition.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Condition</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0053">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is a symptom.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Symptom</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0054">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is a clinical finding.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Finding</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0055">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is a patient complaint.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Complaint</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0056">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is a functional limitation.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Functional limitation</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0057">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is recognised to be causing a problem.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Problem</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0058">
                                                    <items id="description">The issue is regarded as a biomedical diagnosis.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Diagnosis</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0059">
                                                    <items id="description">The problem or issue is of a recurring nature but is currently quiescent.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">In remission</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0060">
                                                    <items id="description">Temporal context indicator aligned with SNOMEDCT.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Temporal context</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0061">
                                                    <items id="description">An issue occuring in the past.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Past</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0062">
                                                    <items id="description">An issue which ocurred at present.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Current</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0063">
                                                    <items id="description">In episodic care contexts (commonly  secondary care) it is common to categorise/ organise problems according to their relationship to the principal problem or diagnosis being addressed during that episode of care. These categories may also be used for clinical coding, reporting and billing purposes.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Episodic care status</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0064">
                                                    <items id="description">The main condition treated or investigated during the relevant episode of care.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Primary diagnosis</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0066">
                                                    <items id="description">A co-morbidity is a condition that exists at the start of the episode of care, which requires treatment, diagnostic procedures or increased clinical care/monitoring.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Co-morbidity</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0067">
                                                    <items id="description">A complication is a condition not present at the start of the episode of care which arises during the episode of care, or is a result of a procedure or treatment during that episode.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Complication</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0068">
                                                    <items id="description">Any other problem or issue deemed significant to the patient's care which does not fall into the one of other categories.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Other current problem</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0069">
                                                    <items id="description">The main procedure performed during the relevant episode of care.</items>
                                                    <items id="text">Primary procedure</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                            </children>
                                            <cardinality>
                                                <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                                                <is_unique>false</is_unique>
                                                <interval>
                                                    <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                                                    <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                                                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                                    <lower>0</lower>
                                                </interval>
                                            </cardinality>
                                        </attributes>
                                    </children>
                                </attributes>
                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">An issue or obstacle which adversely impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual. The definition of a problem is deliberately kept rather loose and inclusive of a formal biomedical diagnosis so as to capture any real or perceived concerns that may adversely affect an individual's wellbeing to any degree.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">structure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the index problem, issue or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="description">The date / time when the problem was first identified by the individual.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date of Onset</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The age of the individual when the problem was first identified by the individual.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Age at Onset</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="comment"> Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The assessed overall severity of the index problem.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Severity</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="description">A narrative description of the  issue, problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="description">The body site affected.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Body Site</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="description">Grouping of information about individual occurrences or exacerbations.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Previous Occurrences</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                    <items id="description">The frequency of individual occurrences of the problem.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Frequency</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                    <items id="description">The date / time of the last occurrence of the problem.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date of last Occurrence</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                    <items id="description">A description of the exacerbation or occurrence.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="description">Number of times this problem has occurred or been apparent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Number</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                    <items id="description">A group of characteristics of the problem complicating the index problem.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Related Item</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of a related problem as text,coded text or link within the EHR.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Item</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                    <items id="description">The type of relationship that this problem/diagnosis has to the related item.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Relationship Type</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                    <items id="description">The date that the problem resolved or went into remission.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date of Resolution</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0031">
                                    <items id="description">The age of the person at the resolution of the problem.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Age at Resolution</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0032">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                    <items id="description">Useful information on the internet about this condition.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Supporting clinical evidence</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                    <items id="description">Details of the body site concerned.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Body Site Details</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0040">
                                    <items id="description">This concept identifies the direct cause or causative agent of a Problem/Diagnosis. The concept includes the idea of complications, causative agent and due to. Note: Where no causality or sequence of events is known, this relationship type should be left blank.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Caused by</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0041">
                                    <items id="description">This value identifies the sequence of events between the related items, but does not assert causality. This can be used for sequelae or late effects. Note: Where no causality or sequence of events is known, this relationship type should be left blank.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Following</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0042">
                                    <items id="description">The criteria on which the problem/diagnosis is based.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Diagnostic Criteria</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                                    <items id="description">Clinical stage or grade of a problem/diagnosis. Note: May include formal severity assessments.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Clinical Stage/Grade</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0044">
                                    <items id="description">A narrative description of the related item.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0046">
                                    <items id="description">Descriptor for context- or use-case specific label or workflow-related aspect of the diagnostic process which may not be safe to exchange between systems or use in a shared environment. Examples include: active/inactive; primary/secondary; preliminary/provisional/working/final.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Status</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Generic, positive statement/s that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000.1">
                                    <items id="description">Positive statement/s about problems or diagnoses that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion of a Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="comment">Use to capture any information that is needed to be positively recorded as being excluded within the record. The statement can support recording global statements or statements about a specified object. See specialisations for Medications, Adverse Reactions, Problem/Diagnosis and Procedures as common examples that have been explicitly modelled.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The statement about an exclusion in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002.1">
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "No known significant problems or diagnoses"; or "No evidence of" or "Never diagnosed with" (diabetes).</items>
                                    <items id="description">A statement about exclusion of use of known problems or diagnoses in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the specific object/s to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Specific Object</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003.1">
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the Problem or Diagnosis with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the specific problems/diagnoses to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the exclusion was last clinically asserted, affirmed or confirmed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date Last Updated</items>

                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>

                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the Exclusion not captured in other fields.</items>

                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">A clinical activity that has been carried out for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure undertaken</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="description">The name of the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="description">Detailed structure describing the procedure carried out, including preparation and details about the method and equipment/devices used.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure Details</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">Was the procedure ultimately unsuccessful? True if unsuccessful.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure unsuccessful</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="description">Comments about the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Comments</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Complication</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="description">Multimedia representation of the procedure, including images.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="description">The reason or indication for the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Reason/s for procedure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="description">An unplanned event prior to or related to the procedure, which may affect its execution e.g patient self-removed cannula.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Unplanned event</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="description">The number of failed attempts to perform the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Failed attempts</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                    <items id="description">Record information about unplanned or unexpected activities that needed to be done during the procedure. Record the name of the task and a description within this archetype, but detail should be recorded in specific linked INSTRUCTION or ACTION archetypes.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Additional tasks</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0031">
                                    <items id="description">Description of additional task performed during the procedure.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Task description</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0032">
                                    <items id="description">Link to a detailed record of the additional task.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Record of additional task</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0034">
                                    <items id="description">Request for procedure is initiated.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Request initiated</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                    <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Request sent</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure has been scheduled.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                    <items id="description">Request for procedure is postponed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Request postponed</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure request has been cancelled.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Request cancelled</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0040">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure has been suspended.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0041">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure has been aborted.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure has been completed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Completed</items>

                                    <items id="text">Report authored</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                    <items id="text">Report attested</items>

                                    <items id="text">Report sent</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0047">
                                    <items id="description">Procedure is being carried out.</items>
                                    <items id="text">In progress</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0048">

                                    <items id="text">Outcome</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                    <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>

                                <term_definitions code="at0055">

                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="description">Generic, positive statement/s that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000.1">
                                    <items id="description">Positive statement/s about procedures that need to be recorded as clinically excluded from the health record at a specific point in time.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion of a Procedure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="comment">Use to capture any information that is needed to be positively recorded as being excluded within the record. The statement can support recording global statements or statements about a specified object. See specialisations for Medications, Adverse Reactions, Problem/Diagnosis and Procedures as common examples that have been explicitly modelled.</items>
                                    <items id="description">The statement about an exclusion in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002.1">
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "No known operations or significant procedures" or "No previous" (appendicectomy).</items>
                                    <items id="description">A statement about exclusion of procedures performed in the health record.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Exclusion Statement</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the specific object/s to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Specific Object</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003.1">
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the Procedure with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the procedures to which the Exclusion Statement applies.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Procedure</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the exclusion was last clinically asserted, affirmed or confirmed.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Date Last Updated</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the Exclusion not captured in other fields.</items>
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                </term_definitions>
